New Records: Dalton Knecht scored 35 points in overtime, leading the Lakers to a comeback win.
Key Match Events: Dalton Knecht forced overtime with a 3-pointer, and then scored 13 of the team's 15 points in overtime.
Anthony Davis scored 35 points and grabbed 10 rebounds, his best performance this preseason.
Pre-Game Insights: Experts didn't predict a comeback win for the Lakers, but the young guys stepped up and rallied in the fourth.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach JJ Redick drew up a clutch-time shot for Dalton Knecht, which he executed perfectly.
Edwin Garcia expressed pride in the Lakers' effort after the comeback win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the Lakers' second win this preseason, and both have come from the young guys stepping up and rallying in the fourth.
Dalton Knecht had a national coming-out party, showing why JJ Redick said he is NBA-ready.
Others: The Lakers have shifted to more small ball, but it's unclear if that's the solution.
Bronny James had the best plus-minus for the Lakers, but it's unclear what it means.
